How to Use Monvvo Mortgage Payoff Calculator

  1. Enter the Remaining Mortgage Balance.
    Provide the current amount you still owe on your mortgage. This is the principal amount remaining on your loan.
  2. Input the Annual Interest Rate.
    Specify the annual interest rate of your mortgage. This rate influences how much interest you’ll continue to pay over the remaining loan term.
  3. Enter Your Current Monthly Payment.
    Include your regular monthly mortgage payment amount. This should reflect the combined principal and interest payments you make each month.
  4. Add Extra Monthly Payment.
    If you plan to make additional monthly payments beyond your regular mortgage payment, input that amount here. Extra payments can reduce the loan term and total interest paid.
  5. Specify the Remaining Loan Term.
    Indicate the number of months left on your mortgage. This information helps in calculating how much longer it will take to pay off the loan based on your current payments.
  6. Provide the Loan Start Date.
    Enter the date your mortgage started. Including this information can help generate a more precise payoff schedule by accounting for the payments you’ve already made.
  7. Calculate Your Mortgage Payoff.
    Once all the necessary details are filled in, click the “Calculate Mortgage Payoff” button to see your updated mortgage payoff timeline. This will show how much sooner you can pay off your loan with extra payments and the total interest savings.

Mortgage Payoff Terms

Remaining Value

Remaining value is the amount you still owe to your lender on your mortgage. This value decreases with each payment you make.

Annual Interest Rate

Annual interest rate is the percentage charged on your remaining loan balance. It is typically expressed as an annual percentage rate (APR) and determines the interest portion of your monthly payments.

Current Monthly Payment

Current monthly payment is the total amount you pay each month towards your mortgage, including both principal and interest. It is essential for calculating your payoff timeline

Extra Monthly Payment

Extra monthly payment is any additional amount you decide to pay each month on top of your regular mortgage payment. Extra payments can help reduce the loan term and the total interest paid over the life of the loan.

Remaining Loan Term

Remaining loan term is the number of months left until your mortgage is paid off. It helps determine how much longer you will be making payments at your current rate.

Loan Start Date

Loan start date is the date your mortgage originally started. Including this can provide a more accurate payoff schedule by accounting for the payments already made.
